column4: The instructions for adding the medibuntu repositories on the Ubuntu Wiki look like they're for Dapper.  Are there any more up to date instructions?
just follow the instructions on the medibuntu website
And use medibuntu's Dapper repositories?
The Medibuntu web site links to the Ubuntu Wiki for installation instructions.  That's why I quoted the Ubuntu Wiki.
sudo wget http://www.medibuntu.org/sources.list.d/gutsy.list -O /etc/apt/sources.list.d/medibuntu.list
then, wget -q http://packages.medibuntu.org/medibuntu-key.gpg -O- | sudo apt-key add - && sudo apt-get update
assuming you're running gutsy of course
where are you getting those instructions from?
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Medibuntu
So, you're just switching gutsy for dapper?
no, i'm just following the instructions
Oh hell, I misread them.  Thanks for letting me know.
:P
move the mount point out of /media
The mount point is /mnt/multimedia...
oh...
heh, next time don't use enter
Eventually he'll reboot and come back I bet.
aww i feel sorry for that litle noob lost in the cli land
I wonder if he knows how to reboot from the command line?  He's probably fighting the urge to pull the plug now....
hahaha, oh god that is harsh.
He'll figure it out, all he has to do is hit the power button.
then he'll come back in a week and complain that is filesystem was corrupted.
